abstract.para: Use this procedure to remove all &sbd;-related configuration from the cluster. You might need to do this if you want to switch from &sbd; to a physical &stonith; device. Keep in mind that to be supported, all &sleha; clusters must have either &sbd; or a physical &stonith; device configured.

Perform this procedure on only one node in the cluster:

step.para: Log in either as the &rootuser; user or as a user with sudo privileges.
Remove the &sbd; configuration from the cluster:

The script stops the &sbd; service on all nodes, moves the &sbd; configuration file to a backup file, and adjusts any &sbd;-related cluster properties. The script also checks whether it is safe to restart the cluster services automatically. If any non-&stonith; resources are running, the script warns you to restart the cluster services manually.

Confirm that the &sbd; configuration is gone:
step.screen: &prompt.user;sudo crm sbd status ERROR: SBD configuration file /etc/sysconfig/sbd not found

step.para: The output should show stonith-enabled=false and no other &sbd;-related properties.
